Minimal admin module with basic session authentication, simple user management, and basic SMTP configuration for internal construction management tool
Focus on completing existing Phase 2 modules before adding new authentication systems
Complete communication hub module implementation first, then add user management as Phase 3
User management is foundational requirement before building additional features - cannot have multi-user application without authentication system
Implement proven NextAuth credentials provider with Gmail SMTP like successful JW Attendant Scheduler implementation

LDC Construction Tools needs user management system. JW Attendant Scheduler successfully implemented NextAuth credentials provider with Gmail SMTP, email invitations, and user management. Same patterns should be applied to LDC project for foundational multi-user functionality before continuing with additional modules.

Proven implementation exists: JW Attendant has working NextAuth system with credentials provider, Gmail SMTP integration, user invitation workflow, and email service class. This is battle-tested code that should be adapted for LDC Construction Tools rather than building from scratch.

Current LDC Construction Tools has no authentication system - anyone can access admin functions. This is a security risk. JW Attendant Scheduler solved this with NextAuth credentials provider and it works in production. Should we copy this proven approach or build different authentication system?
Should we add basic login page to protect admin functions?
What should we do next?
NextAuth JWT authentication implementation for LDC Construction Tools
JWT-based authentication vs database session authentication for LDC Construction Tools with PostgreSQL backend
Industry standard authentication for Next.js applications with PostgreSQL - simplicity and stability requirements
